text: Whoa.
author: brianboyer

text: In other news, it’s awfully convenient that @swear_trek is on giphy now.
author: brianboyer

text: In conclusion, everything is broken and I don’t even know why.
author: brianboyer

text: And non-deterministic systems, well, I don’t even know where to begin.
author: brianboyer

text: If a deterministic system has mystery inputs that your model can’t account for, then it’s perceived as non-deterministic. (I dunno, just reboot it? Maybe try again in a few minutes? Etc.)
author: brianboyer

text:
One of the more important concepts I learned from @lindamood (and also @livlab, IIRC) was the idea of a “mental model” — how, in your mind, a thing works.

And that it doesn’t really matter how the system works in actuality, if the mental model maps clearly to perceived behavior.
author: brianboyer

text:
The problem is, these days, the systems are so complex that we’re only *aware* of a handful of the inputs.

And that's why everything feels fucking broken, even when shit may be working as designed.
author: brianboyer

text:
A thought on computering, inspired with this afternoon's bout with Google Drive:

Most of the software we use every day is a deterministic system. That is, when given a set of inputs, the outputs are predictable.
author: brianboyer

text: cc @jeremybowers
author: brianboyer

text:
Not a comprehensive list, for sure, but I suppose I should add a section titled Building Remote Teams.

Get over the East Coast rent, y’all. There’s talent out here in the sticks!
author: brianboyer

text: (Which isn't all that surprising, I guess. Been trying to fix all the things since I got here, with varying success.)
author: brianboyer

text: This morning it occurred to me that the "What can I do for you?" section of https://brianboyer.net/  is more-or-less just a list of things that news organizations consistently fail at.
author: brianboyer

text: I don't recall how I felt at the time, but that certainly sounds like an authentic NICAR moment. And yes, it's beer-o-clock!
author: brianboyer

text: That was a pretty good panel! :)
author: brianboyer

text: The most joyful thing about working in this biz is watching my peeps kick ass.
author: brianboyer

text: Plus, MORE teammate news! Mister @jeremybowers is on his way back to the Post. https://twitter.com/ktzhu/status/1108135758781571072 … WAUGH
author: brianboyer

text: And excited to watch @rossilynne take the helm at @theinclinepgh, and @LexiBelc kick ass at her new gig w/ @PhillyInquirer!
author: brianboyer

text: It's been an absolute pleasure to work with all the current and emeritus Incline team @colin_deppen @sarahanne_news @rossilynne @LexiBelc @mjslaby @Ldrake5 @fotojaz @wrcroyle. Yinz are the best.
author: brianboyer

text: I'm so damned geeked that the fine nerds at @wherebyus are now teammates with the fine nerds at @theinclinepgh.
author: brianboyer

text: Gah! In all the tweeting (Hi! I'm looking for work!) I forgot to thank @wilto! It's been a while since I cranked out a static site, and the structure of https://hire.wil.to/  was a big inspiration for https://brianboyer.net/ .
author: brianboyer

text:
Rooney!

Aaaaand now I have an excuse to re-read The Iceman List. https://medium.com/message/the-iceman-list-5df51be135d6 …
author: brianboyer

text: If #DesignatedDangerous isn’t the name of the next @detroitsound party/fundraiser, I’m gonna be disappointed.
author: brianboyer

text: (Really feeling Tilly today.)
author: brianboyer

text:
“I am expressing too many feelings right now.”

- Me, in a meeting with important people
author: brianboyer

text: Also, it's a long shot, but does anyone out there want to *start* a news organization? Cuz I'm soooo ready to do that. Shit!! That'd be fun. https://brianboyer.net/
author: brianboyer

text: FWIW, I'm most interested in *local* journalism, which makes this even more challenging. But I've worked remotely with three local teams (@billy_penn @theinclinepgh & @Denverite) for the last two years, and we've done some amazing work together!
author: brianboyer

text: Eleventy!
author: brianboyer

text: (If more journalism organizations were open to remote work, I’d be more confident that I’d stay with the cause!)
author: brianboyer

text:
I’m looking for kind, thoughtful, mission-driven people who are working to make the world better.

Would love to stay in journalism, but I’m open to other options.
author: brianboyer

text: Some news! Soon, I will not have a job. Hire me! https://brianboyer.net/
author: brianboyer

text: Sorry, man. Wasn’t recorded. Was mostly just cussing.
